column2: Wow, not bad. I didn't think anyone\ncould poke around that old mine and\nlive to tell about it...
column3: 真看不出来你这家伙这么厉害，。\n居然可以从废矿坑活着回来...。

column2: Well, did you find anything good\ndown there? I'm always looking to\nbuy...
column3: 废矿坑那里有没有捡到什么好东西？\n我可以跟你高价收购哦。

column2: Hmm, that silver armor... I think\nI might have seen it before.
column3: 啊，那个银之铠...\n怎么好眼熟的样子。

column2: But nothing like that's ever been\nstolen from here, so I'm not sure\nwhen or where I would've...
column3: 我这里遭窃的铠甲\n没有那么光鲜亮丽...。

column2: ...Maybe I'm just a bit touched\nin the head...

column3: 目前这里有的，\n大致就是这些。

column2: Wouldn't this sapphire be\ngreat to give your girlfriend?\nI bet she'd be thrilled!
column3: 把这个蓝宝石\n送给女朋友怎么样？\n她一定很开心哦。

column2: Wouldn't this sapphire be great\nto give your girlfriend? If you\nbuy it now, I'll cut you a deal.
column3: 把这个蓝宝石\n送给女朋友怎么样？\n你要买我就算你便宜。
呵呵呵，我实在是输给你了。

column2: You don't have enough. Sorry,\nbut I've a business to run.
column3: 你的钱不够哦。\n抱歉，一毛钱都不可以少。\n毕竟这可是在做生意。

column2: Oh-ho, I see how it is, then.\nYou negotiate well, my friend!
You see, in business, there's cost,\nand then there's market price...
column3: 每样东西都是有它的市场行情的。

column2: This is a strange one. If you use\nit, it'll warp you back to town\nfrom anywhere in the land.
column3: 这是很神奇的物品哦，\n不管在多远的地方，都能瞬间回到城镇里面。

column2: This is a strange one. If you use\nit, it'll warp you back to town\nfrom anywhere. And it's on sale!
column3: 这是很神奇的物品哦，\n不管在多远的地方，都能瞬间回到城镇里面。\n怎样？要买的话可以算你便宜。
呵呵呵，我实在是输给你了。

column2: You've already got one! And my\ngoods are meant only for those\nwho truly need them...
column3: 上次卖给你的那个\n好像还可以用哦。

column2: Oh-ho, I see how it is, then.\nYou negotiate well, my friend!
This mirror has the power to freeze\nmonsters in time, but it's delicate.\nUse it too often, and it'll shatter.
column3: 这镜子有停止魔物的动作的力量。\n这可是很贵重要的宝物。\n因为它用过几次之后就会坏掉。

column2: This mirror has the power to freeze\nmonsters in time, but it shatters\nwith overuse. It is on sale, though!
column3: 这镜子有停止魔物的动作的力量。\n这可是很贵重要的宝物。\n怎么样，要的话可以算你便宜。

column2: Oh-ho, I see how it is, then.\nYou negotiate well, my friend!
What do you wish\nto sell me?
